meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dingy.
meanings.sent1: The dinginess of the room made it feel unwelcoming.
meanings.sent2: The old curtains added to the dinginess of the house.
meanings.sent3: Despite its dinginess, the old couch was surprisingly comfortable.
meanings.sent4: The dinginess of the alley hinted at its mysterious past.
meanings.sent5: The dinginess of the basement was like a shroud over the forgotten treasures within.

meanings.definition: A dull, dirty, or discolored appearance.
meanings.sent1: She tried to scrub away the dinginess of the walls.
meanings.sent2: The dinginess of the water indicated it needed to be changed.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur had a certain charm despite its dinginess.
meanings.sent4: The dinginess of the old photograph added to its nostalgic feel.
meanings.sent5: The dinginess of the sky before the storm was a warning of what was to come.
